2.text: And they began to accuse Him, saying, “We found this man subverting our nation, forbidding payment of taxes to Caesar, and proclaiming Himself to be Christ, a King.”

3.text: So Pilate asked Him, “Are You the King of the Jews?” “You have said so,” Jesus replied.

4.text: Then Pilate said to the chief priests and the crowds, “I find no basis for a charge against this man.”

5.text: But they kept insisting, “He stirs up the people all over Judea with His teaching. He began in Galilee and has come all the way here.”

6.text: When Pilate heard this, he asked if the man was a Galilean.

7.text: And learning that Jesus was under Herod’s jurisdiction, he sent Him to Herod, who himself was in Jerusalem at that time.

8.text: When Herod saw Jesus, he was greatly pleased. He had wanted to see Him for a long time, because he had heard about Him and was hoping to see Him perform a miracle.

9.text: Herod questioned Jesus at great length, but He gave no answer.

10.text: Meanwhile, the chief priests and scribes stood there, vehemently accusing Him.

11.text: And even Herod and his soldiers ridiculed and mocked Him. Dressing Him in a fine robe, they sent Him back to Pilate.

12.text: That day Herod and Pilate became friends; before this time they had been enemies.

13.text: Then Pilate called together the chief priests, the rulers, and the people,

14.text: and said to them, “You brought me this man as one who was inciting the people to rebellion. I have examined Him here in your presence and found Him not guilty of your charges against Him.

15.text: Neither has Herod, for he sent Him back to us. As you can see, He has done nothing deserving of death.

16.text: Therefore I will punish Him and release Him.”

18.text: But they all cried out in unison: “Away with this man! Release Barabbas to us!”

19.text: (Barabbas had been imprisoned for an insurrection in the city, and for murder.)

20.text: Wanting to release Jesus, Pilate addressed them again,

21.text: but they kept shouting, “Crucify Him! Crucify Him!”

22.text: A third time he said to them, “What evil has this man done? I have found in Him no offense worthy of death. So after I punish Him, I will release Him.”

23.text: But they were insistent, demanding with loud voices for Jesus to be crucified. And their clamor prevailed.

24.text: So Pilate sentenced that their demand be met.

25.text: As they had requested, he released the one imprisoned for insurrection and murder, and he handed Jesus over to their will.

26.text: As the soldiers led Him away, they seized Simon of Cyrene on his way in from the country, and they put the cross on him to carry behind Jesus.

27.text: A great number of people followed Him, including women who kept mourning and wailing for Him.

28.text: But Jesus turned to them and said, “Daughters of Jerusalem, do not weep for Me, but weep for yourselves and for your children.

29.text: Look, the days are coming when people will say, ‘Blessed are the barren women, the wombs that never bore, and breasts that never nursed!’

30.text: At that time ‘they will say to the mountains, “Fall on us!” and to the hills, “Cover us!”’

31.text: For if men do these things while the tree is green, what will happen when it is dry?”

32.text: Two others, who were criminals, were also led away to be executed with Jesus.

33.text: When they came to the place called The Skull, they crucified Him there, along with the criminals, one on His right and the other on His left.

34.text: Then Jesus said, “Father, forgive them, for they do not know what they are doing.” And they divided up His garments by casting lots.

35.text: The people stood watching, and the rulers sneered at Him, saying, “He saved others; let Him save Himself if He is the Christ of God, the Chosen One.”

36.text: The soldiers also mocked Him and came up to offer Him sour wine.

37.text: “If You are the King of the Jews,” they said, “save Yourself!”

38.text: Above Him was posted an inscription: THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.

39.text: One of the criminals who hung there heaped abuse on Him. “Are You not the Christ?” he said. “Save Yourself and us!”

40.text: But the other one rebuked him, saying, “Do you not even fear God, since you are under the same judgment?

41.text: We are punished justly, for we are receiving what our actions deserve. But this man has done nothing wrong.”

42.text: Then he said, “Jesus, remember me when You come into Your kingdom!”

43.text: And Jesus said to him, “Truly I tell you, today you will be with Me in Paradise.”

44.text: It was now about the sixth hour, and darkness came over all the land until the ninth hour.

45.text: The sun was darkened, and the veil of the temple was torn down the middle.

46.text: Then Jesus called out in a loud voice, “Father, into Your hands I commit My Spirit.” And when He had said this, He breathed His last.

47.text: When the centurion saw what had happened, he gave glory to God, saying, “Surely this was a righteous man.”

48.text: And when all the people who had gathered for this spectacle saw what had happened, they returned home beating their breasts.

49.text: But all those who knew Jesus, including the women who had followed Him from Galilee, stood at a distance watching these things.

50.text: Now there was a Council member named Joseph, a good and righteous man,

51.text: who had not consented to their decision or action. He was from the Judean town of Arimathea and was waiting for the kingdom of God.

52.text: He went to Pilate to ask for the body of Jesus.

53.text: Then he took it down, wrapped it in a linen cloth, and placed it in a tomb cut into the rock, where no one had yet been laid.

54.text: It was Preparation Day, and the Sabbath was beginning.

55.text: The women who had come with Jesus from Galilee followed, and they saw the tomb and how His body was placed.

56.text: Then they returned to prepare spices and perfumes. And they rested on the Sabbath, according to the commandment.
